intro: Orophea leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte orophea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, tropical forest environments. Its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences and are adapted for pollination by insects. Orophea leytensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
